revised_title: Thermo-chemistry of Copper and Zinc Alloys: Formation Heats and Intermetallic Compounds
tldr: The authors investigate the heat of formation of various copper and zinc alloys, finding that a maximum heat of formation occurs in the alloy containing 32% copper (CuZn2). The results support the existence of intermetallic compounds and are consistent with Lord Kelvin's calculations of molecular dimensions for copper and zinc.
